snippet: The new method for calculating a consumer’s credit rating will weigh medical debts less heavily and will ignore overdue payments that have been made.
abstract: FICO says latest version of its influential and widely used credit score will no longer weigh medical debts; newer method could raise consumers' credit ratings, as medical obligations account for nearly half of all unpaid collections reported.
lead_paragraph: The new method for calculating a consumer’s credit rating will weigh medical debts less heavily and will ignore overdue payments that have been made.

headline.main: Credit Scores Could Rise With FICO’s New Model
headline.print_headline: Credit Scores Could Rise With FICO’s New Model
